abstract.text: Presented are selected results of semileptonic B decays at BaBar.
Two measurements of the Cabibbo-Kobayashi-Maskawa matrix element |V cb | are reported.
One using moments of the hadronic-mass spectrum in inclusiveB → Xcℓ −ν decays, and the other, exclusive B → Dℓ −ν ℓ decays.
These results are based on data samples of 232 (inclusive B → Xcℓ −ν ) and 460 (exclusive B → Dℓ −ν ℓ ) million Υ(4S) → BB decays, recorded by the BaBar detector at the PEP-II e + e − -storage rings.
Semileptonic B decays are identified by requiring a lepton (e or µ) in events tagged with a full reconstruction of one of the B mesons in the BB pair.

body_text.text: Introduction

In the Standard Model of electroweak interactions, the coupling strength of the b to the c quark in the weak interaction is described by the Cabibbo-Kobayashi-Maskawa (CKM) [1] matrix element |V cb |.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: A precise determination of |V cb | is therefore crucial for probing the CKM mechanism for quark mixing.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Experimentally, |V cb | is obtained usingB → X c ℓ −ν decays with two distinct approaches: An exclusive analysis, where the hadronic system X c is reconstructed in a specific mode.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Or, an inclusive analysis where X c is not reconstructed, but rather summed over all possible hadronic final states.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Theoretically, inclusive determinations rely on an Operator Product Expansion in inverse powers of the b-quark mass [2], which relates the totalB → X c ℓ −ν rate to |V cb |.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Whereas exclusive determinations use Form Factors (FF) to describe the hadronization process.
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Current measurements of |V cb | using inclusive and exclusive determinations generally differ by around two standard deviations, with the inclusive result being twice as precise as the exclusive [3].
body_text.section: Introduction

body_text.text: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample
The semileptonic sample for both exclusive and inclusive measurements are selected using BB events whereby a full reconstruction for one of the B mesons is required (referred to as the B tag ).
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: The B tag [4] candidate is reconstructed using hadronic modes of the type B → D ( * ) Y , where Y represents a collection of charmed hadrons.
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: The remaining particles in the event are assumed to belong to the other B (referred to as the B recoil ), which leaves a very clean sample of semileptonic events.

body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: Using the B tag sample, the B recoil is reconstructed by selecting a lepton (e or µ) with momentum in the CM frame p * ℓ,min above 0.6 GeV.
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: Signal events are then identified using a missing-mass squared value,
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: defined in terms of the measured particle four-momenta.
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: Signal events will peak at zero in the m 2 miss distribution as there is only one associated missing particle (left: Fig. 1).
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: Other semileptonic B decays, such asB → D ( * , * * ) ℓ −ν ℓ (feed-down) will yield larger values of m 2 miss due to higher numbers of missing particles generated from secondary semi-leptonic decays of the D ( * , * * ) .
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: A measurement of |V cb | is made using a fit to the w distribution, where data and MC events are evaluated in ten equal-size bins in the interval 1 < w < 1.6 (right: Fig. 1).
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: Data samples are assumed to contain four different contributions:B → Dℓ −ν ℓ signal events, feed-down from other semileptonic B decays, combinatorial BB and continuum background, and fake lepton events (predominantly from hadronic B decays with hadrons misidentified as leptons).
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: From the fit to the combinedB → Dℓ −ν ℓ sample, a measurement of G(1)|V cb | = (43.0 ± 1.9 ± 1.4) × 10 −3 is made.
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: Using an unquenched lattice calculation, corrected by a factor of 1.007 for QED effects, a value of |V cb | = (39.8 ± 1.8 ± 1.3 ± 0.9 F F ) × 10 −3 is extracted, where the third error is due to the theoretical uncertainty from G(1).
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: The fit method designed to extract the |V cb | from the moments measurements has been reported in [8] and is based on a χ 2 minimization technique.
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: There are eight fit parameters in total namely: |V cb |, the quark masses m b and m c , the total semileptonic branching fraction B(B → X c ℓν), and the dominant non-perturbative HQE parameters µ 2 G and ρ 3 LS .
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: Combined fits to these moments and moments of the photon-energy spectrum in B → X s γ decays [9] have resulted in: |V cb | = (42.07 ± 0.45 ± 0.70) × 10 −3 .
body_text.section: Hadronic Reconstruction for the tagged B sample

body_text.text: Summary and Conclusion
Presented are measurements of |V cb | using exclusive B → Dℓ −ν ℓ decays, and the moments of the hadronic mass distribution in inclusiveB → X c ℓ −ν decays.
body_text.section: Summary and Conclusion

body_text.text: Using the exclusive determination, the fit to the combined sample and an unquenched lattice calculation yields: |V cb | = (39.8 ± 1.8 ± 1.3 ± 0.9 F F ) × 10 −3 .
body_text.section: Summary and Conclusion

body_text.text: Using hadronic mass moments in the inclusive determination yields: |V cb | = (42.05 ± 0.45 ± 0.70) × 10 −3 .
body_text.section: Summary and Conclusion
